intro: Xanthosoma undipes, commonly known as the banana plant or elephant ear, is a member of the Araceae family. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces a tall, leafy stem that bears a cluster of small, white flowers followed by edible berries. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and requires a warm, humid climate. Xanthosoma undipes is often cultivated for its ornamental value and as a food source.
